WRITING.TEXT: In 3 weeks, I'm moving to the big island of Hawaii where I literally know no one! I'm actually excited to make a fresh start, plus it's Hawaii.

Social media... gotta love the PR campaign we all trot out in front of friends and family. I wish people would be real with each other, but not in hurtful ways.
Have you shared these feelings/thoughts with your parents? They obviously love you and would want to help in any way they could.
Holidays are weird, sometimes they make us happy, sometimes we're just numb to it all. I found that if I just put on the Jack Johnson music, all my worries seem to float away.
I don't want you to die. Get help before this spirals too far...
Did something happen that made you start feeling this way?
Thanks!

I had the estimator come today, and the estimate arrive mere moments ago. Our estimated total was 6,119 lbs, which is about $10k to move. We can save about $5k by just packing things up ourselves and loading/unloading the container.
If only... I'm surprised it's not more popular with all the Californians visiting.

I really love driving in Hawaii. It takes me a few days to adjust, but it is so much less stressful than here in LA. When I return to the mainland and get on the 405 freeway with everyone doing 80, I feel like I'm on a speedway. At first it's exhilarating, but then I realize it's 80 or bumper-to-bumper...

Thanks! I reached out to Royal Hawaiian to see if that is a better route for us, we'll see what they say. The 20' container is only 5200 door to door with Matson (and a 3rd party trucking company for the port-home part on the island), but I do have to load/unload myself. The part that makes it hard to compare is that Royal ships by pound and I honestly cannot even guess what the weight would be, but with a container I can visualize the size (I loaded containers as a job for a year of my life).
It does baffle my mind to imagine snow in Hawaii, but we will be bringing enough winter clothing for a snow day or two.

I heard that Kona is not great for road biking, but as a family our bike rides never venture very far. Our neighborhood will have nice wide streets with real sidewalks, something we don't have currently.
What about a Nissan Rogue? Would that be worth much? We would be driving it for a while but I expect we'll sell it and get a minivan.
Hoping to have money left over after the move... it's bonus time so there is a strong possibility!
That's a good plan.

WRITING.TITLE: Moving to Kona in 1 month, what should I bring?
WRITING.TEXT: Hi everyone, I posted a while back that I would be moving from California to Hawaii, and the comments from this sub were super helpful in making our plans. We have just signed a 14 month lease on a house in Kona (Pualani Estates), so we'll be packing up all our belongings in a 20' container in about 2 weeks. I'm curious what you all would recommend we bring and what you would leave behind (sell/giveaway). I have a wife and 2 kids, no pets, I'll be working from home. Are bicycles useful on the Big Island? What about some brand new IKEA furniture (unassembled, still in the box) - I live near an IKEA and I was thinking I could buy some here and sell it for a profit on CL in HI, if we don't end up needing it ourselves. We probably don't need every inch of the 20' container, and it's a fixed fee to ship it so weight is not a concern. I'm also planning to ship my 2009 Nissan Rogue as our family car, separately. Is there anything that is hard to find or expensive on the Big Island that I should bring over? Thoughts? Suggestions?
9' tall mirrored closet doors, 2 sets!
Who came up with these numbers.?
Seems all over central Europe it is having issues. http://downdetector.com/status/google/map/

WRITING.TITLE: Creepy face in the untouched tissue.
The face in the tissue. Happened completely by itself.

WRITING.TEXT: Loosely related... When I was about 9 I had been reading in my school's health book about something that I had not heard before. I decided to ask my dad what this was, in a loud clear voice, in the silent moment at a packed movie theater between when the previews end and the movie is about to start: "Dad, what's a bowel movement?". Lots of chuckles from strangers and I had no idea why.
I feel like this is often the motive for mass-murder. The media can make you a household name. I can name more mass-murderers than US senators, for example.
1 like = 1 prayer
Nope. Wired means you connect to the sound source with a wire. There is a cable between them, but that doesn't make it wired.

I did for a while... they fall apart after a few months and so I kept having to replace them. About 2 months ago I switched to the silicone tips and it's so much simpler to take them in and out. Also, the foam collects earwax like it's going out of style... then I display it to all my co-workers while they talk to me! Silicone is really the way to go.

Jaybird X2. All-day battery life, great Bluetooth connection, controls are rubberized, blocks out sound very well. I don't want perfect noise cancellation, since co-workers need to get my attention sometimes.
Except the X2's can't do wired, so it's wrong right out of the gate. This seems like a risky thing to do since it can get things wrong very often...
Agreed. You really need a week on each island to "see" it, preferably 2 weeks. I would not island hop unless it was a 3 week trip.
Source? They do howl, so I guess some short howls could be called a bark.
Fun fact: Dingoes don't bark!
When I drank a cold diet coke as a kid, it would feel as though the cold liquid traveled through my left shoulder on the way to my stomach. Never happened with any other drink.

Cross country. I was on the school's team for 2 years, and the first day of practice for what would have been the 3rd year, my mom drove me there super late, so late that I actually saw the group running from the car window and had this epiphany that it was a complete waste of effort and decided not to go. My mom had plans to see "My best friend's wedding" at the movie theater, so there I was too, in my running clothes. I haven't ever been able to get back into running.
I've seen 25 or so random episodes a long time ago in crappy real audio format, but never in order or from the beginning.
I got that reference. I literally just watched that episode yesterday for the first time!
Ex-leper?
Or that feeling when you press the button to retract the cord and it comes perfectly to you without slapping anything (or anyone) along the way!
Can you come to my house please?? I do not like it and neither does my wife so we go months without it... maybe we can train the kid when she's old enough? :P
I am having candy, thank you! Free mint from the taco place...
thanks!

I love both, podcasts are "evergreen" so that's my default, but I did listen to about 7 books on Audible a while back and really liked it. I hear overdrive is a way to get free audiobooks from the library, so if I can get that set up I will be back on a mix of the two.

WRITING.TITLE: Eventually my Reddit account history will have enough info to identify me. Should I create a new account each year or two?
WRITING.TEXT: I don't care about karma, I just like that it's anonymous. The ease with which someone can view my past posts and put the clues together does worry me a bit. Ken Bone's situation got me thinking about this...
Got major chills/cringes, but I let it replay anwyays!

I can't do much of my day job with podcasts/audiobooks playing (I'm a programmer), but when a rote task comes along I get excited because I can listen to whatever I want at that point. NPR's Invisibilia podcast is amazing, btw!
That's yardwork for me. I add podcasts on my bluetooth headphones and I'm in heaven.
I love that too, I never even thought of it as a chore!
